Key Match Events: India beat Sri Lanka in the Super Over and won the series 3-0.
Maheesh Theekshana picked up three wickets to restrict India to a low total.
Indian spinners restricted Sri Lanka to 137/8, the same score India made in the first innings.
Suryakumar Yadav started his captaincy on a winning note.
In the Super Over, India scored 4/0 in 0.1 overs, while Sri Lanka managed 2/2 in 0.3 overs.
Washington Sundar took two wickets in the Super Over.
Rinku Singh took a crucial catch in the Super Over.
Ravi Bishnoi and Washington Sundar formed a crucial partnership for India.
Rinku Singh picked up two wickets in the 19th over.
Ravi Bishnoi got the breakthrough wicket of Kushal Mendis.
Suryakumar Yadav bowled the final over and picked up two wickets.
Khaleel Ahmed had a poor over, giving away 12 runs.
Riyan Parag picked up two wickets in the 19th over.
Washington Sundar took two wickets in the 17th over.
Ravi Bishnoi took the wicket of Kushal Mendis.
Ramesh Mendis picked up the wicket of Shivam Dube.
Ashita Fernando picked up the wicket of Suryakumar Yadav.
Chamindu Wickramasinghe picked up the wicket of Sanju Samson.
Maheesh Theekshana picked up the wicket of Rinku Singh.
Maheesh Theekshana picked up the wicket of Yashasvi Jaiswal.
Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav mentioned the brand of cricket India wants to play and the importance of being the best version of themselves.
Charith Asalanka mentioned the dry pitch and the difficulty of batting when the ball gets older.
Arshdeep Singh talked about his journey in international cricket and his focus on the process rather than results.
Russell Arnold mentioned the pitch conditions, predicting that it would turn and that slower balls would be effective.
Axar Patel discussed his journey in Indian cricket and his role as a floater in the team.
Vikram Rathour praised Shubman Gill's leadership qualities and body language.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav expressed happiness for the boys and their performance, mentioning the brand of cricket they want to play.
Charith Asalanka expressed disappointment with Sri Lanka's batting at the death and the need for improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was delayed by rain.
The pitch was dry and expected to turn, with slower balls being effective.
The atmosphere was buzzing, and there were concerns about intermittent showers.
Sri Lanka's batting collapsed for a second successive night.
Sri Lanka's women's team won the Asia Cup by defeating India.
